intro: Hemigraphis strigosa, commonly known as velvetleaf or Mexican nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves that give it a velvety appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Hemigraphis strigosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is commonly found in the understory of tropical forests.
